resources.string: Clippy: It looks like you\'re trying to awaken from cryosleep. Would you like my help?
Clippy: Excellent! It says here your name is
Program received signal SIGSEGV: Segmentation Fault
Clippy: Ah, I seem to have forgotten it. Remind me\?

Clippy: I pronounce that right? Anyways, our Macrosoft™ Active Starship Administrator™ set a policy requiring all users to have a password. That said, they didn\'t set a minimum length, so you can make like Stallman and set it to newline (i.e. nothing)
Cool password! So, tell me when you\'re ready, and I\'ll go ahead and register you. Then I can give you a brief introduction, if you\'d like.
Mine flag limit reached. Remove at least one mine flag
There was a problem setting up the game
There was a problem resetting the game

It seems like you\'ve awakened a bit early… I wonder why. Ah, now I remember: the ship\'s reactors are failing. Fun! Unfortunately, for security reasons, AIs are not allowed to control the reactors directly. The controls are physical and cannot be connected to through the ShipNet™. We can, however project holograms to drastically simplify the controls. This is where you come in. We have 3 reactor control panels we need you to manage.
One is the "Reactor View", a set of "sliding tiles" that need to be arranged in sorted order. If you fling your ControlScreen™ left, you can undo, and if you fling it right, you can redo.

We also have the "Reactor Model", a collection of buttons to move the reactor\'s control rods. We kind of… forgot what each button did, but you can undo up to three erroneous rod insertions by pushing the circular button at the top to inject coolant.

Finally, we have the reactor controller, where you can try your hand at controlling the reactor\'s throttle. Hit red hot spots and you\'ll damage a core, hit blue squares and you\'ll increase efficiency
